result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Aaron R. Clah was found guilty of Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Aaron R. Clah was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Restitution paid in full prior to sentencing date.
Undergo a mental health/psychological evaluation and comply with all treatment recommendations.

Write a letter apology to all the victims, including victims of the damaged mailboxes, due within 30 days, and pre-approved by the probation agent.
Provide a DNA sample or show proof of prior submission.

timeConds.notes:
Conditional jail term shall commence immediately.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Credit given for any administrative suspension.
Undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with driver safety plan.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Granted, and may be allowed for attendance at the O.W.I. Victim Impact Panel on January 8, 2015.

timeConds.notes:
Conditional jail term shall begin immediately.  Good time is granted.
Concurrent with: With Count 1 in this case.

records.addlTxt: to Attend Victim Impact Panel
Interlock Ignition Device Court Order
from J.L.B.

Defendant Aaron R. Clah in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Krist S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement placed on the record.  Plea of no contest to Cts. 1 and 2.  Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty and ordered entry of JOC.  Pursuant to the agreement the remaining charge as well as the tracking citations (14TR831, 832, 833, and 834) are dismissed.  Brief statements by counsel.  On Ct. 1 the court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for 3 years with the following conditions:  Restitution of $589.96 - paid prior to sentencing; 12 months county jail with Huber to start immediately; letter of apology to all the victims, due within 30 days, pre-approved by the probation agent; pay court costs; pay DNA surcharge and provide a DNA sample or show proof of prior submission; undergo a psychological evaluation and comply with all treatment recommendations.  On Ct. 2 the court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for three years with the following conditions:  $2135.00 fine with court costs inclusive; 100 days county jail with Huber and Good Time, concurrent to Ct. 1; 27 month DL revocation, with credit given for and administrative suspension; $41.00 BDR; IID for at least one year; AODA and comply with driver safety plan; attend the O.W.I. Victim Impact Panel on January 8, 2015, for which Huber may be allowed.  51 days sentence credit given.

Defendant Aaron R. Clah in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Defendant Aaron R. Clah in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court bound DE over for trial.  Informaiton filed, waived further reading of same; and entered a plea of not guiltly to the charges.  Matter to be scheduled for a plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 2, 2014 at 08:45 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.
Preliminary hearing on November 26, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Aaron R. Clah in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Kristi Sue Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waived further reading of complaint; preliminary hearing requested with time limits not waived.  PTC requested and set.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 26, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant
Tayulor County Arrest Report

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $10,000 cash bond with conditions of:  comply with booking; not possess or consume any alcohol; not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Response by defendant.  Court ordered a $1000 cash bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for November 18, 2014 at 1:00 p.m.
